charge_type.source: Offence:   Trafficking in dangerous drugs (販運危險藥物)

drugs.source: 112.35 grammes of a solid containing 85.63 grammes of cocaine
211.16 grammes of a solid containing 170.37 grammes of ketamine

roles.source: I am satisfied that the role of the defendant is one of storekeeper and courier.
I am satisfied that the role of the defendant is one of storekeeper and courier.

mitigating_factors.other_factor: Remorse; supportive letters from family; unemployment and redundancy; approached/tempted by an old school friend and paid to store and deliver; attempted to return drugs but threatened with repayment obligation
mitigating_factors.source: He is grateful for their continued support ... I have a letter from the defendant who deeply regrets committing this offence ... he was made redundant ... tempted by an old school friend who promised an easy job ... He tried to return the drugs but was told if he quit the job, he would need to repay $30,000 ... I do have a mitigation letter from the defendant’s parents who are very supportive and accept the defendant’s remorse as genuine.

guilty_plea.source: The defendant pleaded guilty to one count of trafficking in dangerous drugs on 20 February 2025. He was committed to the Court of First Instance for sentence. Today he confirms his plea and admission of the Summary of Facts.

starting_point.source: I take the view that the combined approach should be adopted here using cocaine as the base drug ... I calculate a total of 128.22 grammes of cocaine, which will mathematically attract a starting point of 10 years and 1 month imprisonment. I find the mathematical starting point of 10 years’ imprisonment appropriate in this case.

sentence_after_role.source: I am satisfied that the role of the defendant is one of storekeeper and courier. I find the mathematical starting point of 10 years’ imprisonment appropriate in this case.

notional_sentence.source: I calculate a total of 128.22 grammes of cocaine, which will mathematically attract a starting point of 10 years and 1 month imprisonment. I find the mathematical starting point of 10 years’ imprisonment appropriate in this case.

final_sentence.source: The defendant pleaded guilty at the earliest opportunity and is entitled to a full one-third discount. I will take the starting point of 10 years and reduce it by one-third. The defendant is sentenced to 6 years and 8 months’ imprisonment.
